bill_title: assign responsibility related to certain infestations of noxious weeds or the mountain pine beetle.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assign liability for certain attempts to prevent or delay the control or eradication of weeds and pests. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If any person or entity takes legal action in any form to prevent or delay any federal, state, or local government agency or any person from attempting to control or eradicate an infestation of weeds or pests on any public land, including federal land for which a state or local government agency has applied for permission to attempt to control or eradicate such an infestation, and if the infestation subsequently spreads to adjacent private land, the person or entity that brought such legal action is liable to the owner of the private land for damages resulting from the infestation. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assign liability for certain attempts to prevent or delay the control or eradication of weeds and pests. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If any person or entity takes legal action in any form to prevent or delay any federal, state, or local government agency or any person from attempting to control or eradicate an infestation of weeds or pests, as defined by state law, on any public land, including federal land for which a state or local government agency has applied for permission to attempt to control or eradicate such an infestation, and if the infestation subsequently spreads to adjacent private land, the person or entity that brought such legal action is liable to the owner of the private land for damages resulting from the infestation. BILL HISTORY 1/15/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 59 1/18/00 Referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. H.J. 120 1/25/00 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 1/25/00 Agriculture and Natural Resources Do Pass Amended, Passed, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 220

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Agriculture and Natural Resources Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assign liability for certain attempts to prevent or delay the control or eradication of weeds or the mountain pine beetle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If any person or entity takes legal action in any form to prevent or delay any federal, state, or local government agency or any person from attempting to control or eradicate an infestation of weeds, as defined by state law, or an infestation of the mountain pine beetle on any public land, including federal land for which a state or local government agency has applied for permission to attempt to control or eradicate such an infestation, and if the infestation subsequently spreads to adjacent private land, the person or entity that brought such legal action is liable to the owner of the private land for damages resulting from the infestation. BILL HISTORY 1/15/00 First read in House and referred to committee assignment waived. H.J. 59 1/18/00 Referred to Agriculture and Natural Resources. S.J. 406

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to assign responsibility related to certain infestations of noxious weeds or the mountain pine beetle. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. If an infestation of noxious weeds or an infestation of mountain pine beetle spreads to adjacent private or public land, the person or entity owning the property from which the infestation spread is responsible for remedying the problems caused by the infestation, to the extent that the person or entity is responsible for allowing the infestation to spread to the adjacent private or public land.
